senses.de: Following rules or standards very closely
senses.ex: The teacher is strict about homework.

Tips.title: Authority figure
Tips.description: Often used to describe someone in charge, like a parent or teacher, who enforces rules
Tips.example: He grew up with a strict father who had firm rules.

Tips.title: Expect compliance
Tips.description: Used where rules must be followed without exception, showing no leniency
Tips.example: The military training was strict and allowed no room for error.

Tips.title: Severity
Tips.description: Conveys a sense of harshness or lack of flexibility in rules or discipline
Tips.example: The school's strict dress code prohibited casual wear.

senses.ex: I made a strict comparison between the two products.

Tips.title: Attention to detail
Tips.description: Emphasizes the importance of accuracy and careful execution in work or study
Tips.example: The scientist's strict methodology yielded reliable results.

Tips.title: No deviations
Tips.description: Used to describe situations where precision is critical and variations are unacceptable
Tips.example: Strict measurements are vital in construction to ensure structural integrity.

Tips.title: High standards
Tips.description: Refers to maintaining very high criteria or expectations, usually in quality or performance
Tips.example: The editor was strict with her writers, demanding high-quality content.

senses.de: Specifies that a code or program can only be executed in its exact form with no changes
senses.ex: The strict mode in javascript does not allow undeclared variables.

Tips.title: Programming precision
Tips.description: In computing, indicates code must be written and executed without any errors or variations
Tips.example: He enabled strict mode to avoid issues during the program's execution.

Tips.title: Error prevention
Tips.description: Using strict settings in programming helps to prevent unintended behaviors or bugs
Tips.example: Strict error checking helped find faults in the code early.

senses.de: Describes an inequality that is not equal or equivalent
senses.ex: In a strict inequality, the values are not the same and are not equal.

Tips.title: Mathematical precision
Tips.description: In math, refers to precise inequality where equality is not permitted
Tips.example: For x < y, called a strict inequality, x can never equal y.

Tips.title: No equality allowed
Tips.description: Used in mathematics to indicate a relationship where one value is strictly less than or greater than another
Tips.example: She learned that 'strictly greater than' excludes the possibility of being equal.

Authoritative.wordDefinition:
Authoritative means having power or knowledge and being respected because of it. It is applicable when someone knows a lot about a certain topic or subject and is able to give information or direction with confidence and credibility.

So, in short, authoritative is about having knowledge and being respected for it, while strict is about enforcing rules and not allowing exceptions.

Exact.wordDefinition:
Exact means completely accurate, without any mistakes or errors. It is applicable when someone wants a precise or accurate answer or measurement.

For example, if a teacher asks a student to give an exact answer to a mathematical problem, the student should provide an answer that is 100% correct.

Firm.wordDefinition:
Firm means having a strong and steady attitude towards something. This may involve being assertive and confident while setting limits and boundaries.

For example, a parent might have a firm parenting style that involves being consistent and clear with their expectations.

Firm suggests a strong and assertive approach, while strict suggests a harsh and inflexible approach. Both can be applicable in different contexts, depending on the situation and the person involved.

Harsh.wordDefinition:
Harsh means cruel, unpleasant, or severe, and it's often used to describe punishment or criticism that is overly harsh.

Strict means rigid, demanding, or exacting, and it's often used to describe rules or expectations. For example, a teacher might have strict rules for their classroom, while a parent might be harsh in their discipline.

Overall, while both words are used to describe someone who is firm or uncompromising, harsh has a more negative connotation than strict.

Inflexible.wordDefinition:
Inflexible means something that cannot be bent or changed, while strict refers to being firm in enforcing rules or standards.

For example, an inflexible rule may mean that there is no room for negotiation or flexibility, and the rule must be followed exactly.

Inflexible refers to something that is unchangeable or immovable, while strict refers to someone who is firm, but may still be open to exceptions or different interpretations.

Rigorous.wordDefinition:
Rigorous means very thorough and precise, with attention to detail and accuracy.

Rigorous emphasizes thoroughness and attention to detail, whereas strict emphasizes strict adherence to rules and regulations.

Severe.wordDefinition:
Severe means extremely serious or intense, while strict means following rules or requirements very closely.

For example, a severe weather condition would refer to a very extreme or intense weather event like a hurricane or tornado, whereas a strict teacher would enforce classroom rules consistently and not tolerate any deviation from those rules.

Severe is more appropriate for situations that are extreme or intense, while strict is more appropriate for situations that involve rules or guidelines that need to be followed closely.

Stern.wordDefinition:
Stern means showing a serious and unfriendly attitude. It is applicable when someone wants to convey a severe and uncompromising tone to someone else, like a parent scolding a child for misbehaving.

Stern is for conveying an unfriendly tone, while strict is for conveying a rigid adherence to rules or principles.

Stringent.wordDefinition:
Stringent means something that is very strict and demanding. For instance, stringent security measures are required to enter a bank vault.

To summarize, strict is used in situations where someone follows rules closely while stringent applies to situations that require strict rules and regulations.

quotes.Text: I think I am very hands-on mother. I am very strict, and my daughter keeps telling me, 'You are too hard on me,' and I keep telling her, 'I have to be hard because if I am not hard, you will not learn the lessons that I want you to learn.' I think it is really important to be that way.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Kajol

quotes.Text: My parents were fairly laid-back, but there were certain things about which they were very strict. My brother and I were told never to turn away a person in need. And it didn't matter what we thought of their motives, whether they were truly in need or not.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Hisham Matar

quotes.Text: Sometimes I make up songs, and they're just strictly fiction. Other times, I draw on things that have happened in my life or friends, women, all sorts of things.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: J. J. Cale

quotes.Text: If there wasn't any business and it was just strictly basketball, then there would be no issue, it would probably be done by now. But the team has to protect.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Jason Kidd

quotes.Text: I am attached to a strict approach to Brexit: I respect the British vote, but the worst thing would be a sort of weak E.U. vis-a-vis the British.
quotes.Title: French Politician
quotes.Name: Emmanuel Macron

quotes.Text: I won't say I am a strict mother, but discipline is important. Timing and routine are important for kids.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Karisma Kapoor

quotes.Text: Good conditioning helps you prepare your muscles, so I make sure I'm always strict with my conditioning.
quotes.Title: Brazilian Mixed Martial Artist
quotes.Name: Glover Teixeira

quotes.Text: It's important for parents to be strict if you want the kids to succeed.
quotes.Title: American Wrestler
quotes.Name: Geeta Phogat

quotes.Text: My first teacher... was extremely strict, mean, and deeply religious.
quotes.Title: Swedish Musician
quotes.Name: Tobias Forge
